sen.j: 杉本氏（すぎもとし）は日本の武家のひとつ。
sen.e: The Sugimoto clan is one of the samurai families in Japan.
The Sugimoto clan is one of the samurai families in Japan.
The Sugimoto clan is one of the samurai families in Japan.

sen.j: 清和源氏 源為義流 杉本氏
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), Sugimoto clan
The MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), Sugimoto clan
The MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), Sugimoto clan

sen.j: 杉本氏は本姓は源氏。
sen.e: The Sugimoto clan's real family name is Genji.
The Sugimoto clan's real family name is Genji.
The Sugimoto clan's real family name is Genji.

sen.j: 家系は清和天皇の血をひく清和源氏のひとつ河内源氏の流れ。
sen.e: Their family lineage is the line of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), one of the Seiwa-Genji, the clan of royal blood of Emperor Seiwa.
Their family lineage is the line of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), one of the Seiwa-Genji, the clan of royal blood of Emperor Seiwa.
Their family lineage is the line of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), one of the Seiwa-Genji, the clan of royal blood of Emperor Seiwa.

sen.j: 源頼朝の祖父 源為義の庶子 杉本為国より発祥する。
sen.e: The Sugimoto clan came from Tamekuni SUGIMOTO, a child born out of wedlock of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, the ground father of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
The Sugimoto clan came from Tamekuni SUGIMOTO, a child born out of wedlock of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, the grandfather of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
The Sugimoto clan came from Tamekuni SUGIMOTO, a child born out of wedlock of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi, the grandfather of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

sen.j: 家紋は蔦。
sen.e: Their family crest is ivy.
Their family crest is ivy.
Their family crest is ivy.

sen.j: 桓武平氏 三浦氏流 杉本氏
sen.e: Miura clan line of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), Sugimoto clan
The Miura clan line of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), Sugimoto clan
The Miura clan line of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), Sugimoto clan

sen.j: 杉本氏の本姓は平氏。
sen.e: The real family name of the Sugimoto clan is Heishi.
The real family name of the Sugimoto clan is Heishi.
The real family name of the Sugimoto clan is Heishi.

sen.j: 家系は桓武天皇の流れを汲む平氏の平良文を祖とする三浦氏の庶家である。
sen.e: Their family lineage is the branch family of the Miura clan which descended from TAIRA no Yoshifumi of Heishi, the clan of royal blood of Emperor Seiwa.
Their family lineage is the branch family of the Miura clan, which descended from TAIRA no Yoshifumi of Heishi, the clan of royal blood of Emperor Seiwa.
Their family lineage is the branch family of the Miura clan, which descended from TAIRA no Yoshifumi of Heishi, the clan of royal blood of Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 三浦義明の長男 杉本義宗(椙本とも)が起源で鎌倉の杉本城(現在の杉本寺)を拠点としたことから杉本を称した。
sen.e: The family used the name Sugimoto because they originated from Yoshimune SUGIMOTO (also written as 椙本 in Chinese characters) and based on Sugimoto-jo Castle (Sugimoto-dera Temple today).

The family used the name Sugimoto because they originated from Yoshimune SUGIMOTO (also written as 椙本 in Chinese characters) and were based at Sugimoto-jo Castle (the present-day Sugimoto-dera Temple).

The family used the name Sugimoto because they originated from Yoshimune SUGIMOTO (also written as 椙本 in Chinese characters) and were based at Sugimoto-jo Castle (the present-day Sugimoto-dera Temple).

sen.j: 杉本氏からは、初代の鎌倉幕府侍所別当 和田義盛にはじまる和田氏が別れた他、杉浦氏、鮎川氏、走水氏などの庶流が別れた。
sen.e: From the Sugimoto clan, the Wada clan that originated from Yoshimori WADA, Samuraidokoro Betto (an administrator of the Board of Retainers) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), separated and other branch families such as the Sugiura clan, the Ayukawa clan, and the Hashirimizu clan also separated.
sen.cmt: 走水氏の読み方不明です（用語集も不明）。
sen.e: From the Sugimoto clan, the Wada clan, which originated from Yoshimori WADA, Samuraidokoro Betto (an administrator of the Board of Retainers) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), separated, and other branch families such as the Sugiura clan, as did the Ayukawa and Hashirimizu clans.

From the Sugimoto clan, the Wada clan, which originated from Yoshimori WADA, Samuraidokoro Betto (an administrator of the Board of Retainers) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), separated, and other branch families such as the Sugiura clan, as did the Ayukawa and Hashirimizu clans.

sen.j: また、杉本義宗の弟で三浦本宗家を相続した三浦義澄の次男 佐原義連の家系からも杉本氏がわかれ、義連の子 横須賀時連に杉本宗明という子がおり以後、杉本氏として存続した。
sen.e: The Sugimoto clan also separated from the family line of Yoshitsura SAHARA, the second son of Yoshizumi MIURA who was the younger brother of Yoshimune SUGIMOTO and inherited the head family of the Miura family, and Tokitsura YOKOSUKA, the son of Yoshitsura, had a son named Muneaki SUGIMOTO and from this son, the family remained as the Sugimoto clan.
sen.cmt: 杉本宗明の読み方不明です（用語集も不明）。
sen.e: The Sugimoto clan also separated from the family line of Yoshitsura SAHARA, the second son of Yoshizumi MIURA, who was the younger brother of Yoshimune SUGIMOTO, and inherited the head family of the Miura family, and Tokitsura YOKOSUKA, the son of Yoshitsura, had a son named Muneaki SUGIMOTO, and from this son the family remained as the Sugimoto clan.

The Sugimoto clan also separated from the family line of Yoshitsura SAHARA, the second son of Yoshizumi MIURA, who was the younger brother of Yoshimune SUGIMOTO, and inherited the head family of the Miura family, and Tokitsura YOKOSUKA, the son of Yoshitsura, had a son named Muneaki SUGIMOTO, and from this son the family remained as the Sugimoto clan.

sen.j: 杉本宗明(下野国)－杉本時明(安芸国)－杉本貞連(因幡国)－杉本貞清－杉本駒石丸－杉本久連－杉本連秀－杉本義清－杉本義定と続いた。
sen.e: The clan carried the name in the following line: Muneaki SUGIMOTO (Shimotsuke Province) - Tokiaki SUGIMOTO (Aki Province) - Sadatsura SUGIMOTO (Inaba Province) - Sadakiyo SUGIMOTO - Komaishimaru SUGIMOTO - Hisatsura SUGIMOTO - Tsurahide SUGIMOTO - Yoshikiyo SUGIMOTO - Yoshisada SUGIMOTO.
sen.cmt: 名前の読み方不明です（用語集も不明）。
sen.e: The clan carried the name in the following line: Muneaki SUGIMOTO (Shimotsuke Province) - Tokiaki SUGIMOTO (Aki Province) - Sadatsura SUGIMOTO (Inaba Province) - Sadakiyo SUGIMOTO - Komaishimaru SUGIMOTO - Hisatsura SUGIMOTO - Tsurahide SUGIMOTO - Yoshikiyo SUGIMOTO - Yoshisada SUGIMOTO.

sen.j: なお、宗明の次男が三浦姓に復して美作三浦氏を起こし戦国大名として栄えた。
sen.e: In addition, the second son of Muneaki returned to the name of Miura and originated the Miura clan and the clan flourished as a warring lord.
Additionally, the second son of Muneaki returned to the Miura name; he originated the Miura clan, which then flourished as a warring lord.
Additionally, the second son of Muneaki returned to the Miura name; he originated the Mimasaka Miura clan, which then flourished as a warring lord.

sen.j: 藤原氏 上杉氏流 杉本氏
sen.e: Uesugi clan line of Fujiwara clan, Sugimoto clan

sen.j: 勧修寺家の傍流 越後国守護 上杉氏の庶家に杉本氏がある。
sen.e: There are the Sugimoto clan in a branch family of the Uesugi clan, Echigo no Shugo (the provincial constable of Echigo Province), a branch of the Kajuji family.
The Sugimoto clan is represented in a branch family of the Uesugi clan, Echigo no Shugo (the provincial constable of Echigo Province), a branch of the Kajuji family.

sen.j: 伊予橘氏（越智氏） 楠木氏流 杉本氏
sen.e: Kusunoki clan line of Iyotachibana clan (the Ochi clan), Sugimoto clan
The Kusunoki clan line of the Iyotachibana clan (the Ochi clan), Sugimoto clan

sen.j: また、楠木正成の一族にも杉本氏が確認される。
sen.e: There are also found the Sugimoto clan in the family of Masashige KUSUNOKI.
Moreover, the Sugimoto clan is found in the family of Masashige KUSUNOKI.

sen.j: 本姓は伊予橘氏（越智氏一族）。
sen.e: The real family name is the Iyotachibana clan (family of the Ochi clan).

sen.j: 家系は河野氏の一族である橘遠保の流れを汲むという。
sen.e: It is said that their family lineage followed the line of TACHIBANA no Toyasu, the family of the Kono clan.

sen.j: 『若狭小浜杉本院系図』に曰く、楠木正隆 (武士)の子 楠木俊親に杉本貞隆という子がいたという。
sen.e: According to the "Family tree of the Wakasa Obama Sugimoto-in Temple," Toshichika KUSUNOKI, the son of Masataka KUSUNOKI, had the son named Sadataka SUGIMOTO.
sen.cmt: 名前の読み方不明です（用語集も不明）。
sen.e: According to the "Family Tree of the Wakasa Obama Sugimoto-in Temple," Toshichika KUSUNOKI, the son of Masataka KUSUNOKI, had a son named Sadataka SUGIMOTO.

sen.j: 貞隆は右衛門尉と称され丹波国杉本に生まれ世に杉本殿と称されたという。
sen.e: It is believed that Sadataka was called Uemon no jo (the third ranked official of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards) and was born in Sugimoto, Tanba Province and called as Sugimoto-dono.
It is believed that Sadataka was called Uemon no jo (the third-ranked official of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards) and was born in Sugimoto, Tanba Province and called Sugimoto-dono.

sen.j: 家系は杉本貞隆－杉本貞俊－杉本俊胤－杉本諸正－杉本正胤－杉本委正－杉本信貴－杉本盛長－杉本良海と続いた。
sen.e: The clan carried the name in the following line: Sadataka SUGIMOTO - Sadatoshi SUGIMOTO - Toshitane SUGIMOTO - Moromasa SUGIMOTO - Masatane SUGIMOTO - Tomomasa SUGIMOTO - Nobutaka SUGIMOTO - Morinaga SUGIMOTO - Yoshimi SUGIMOTO.
